The introduction of milled (machine-made) coins by the Royal Mint, replacing hand-hammered coins, marked a major turning point in coin production. articles.summary: The People's Bank of China allowed the yuan to depreciate beyond 7.2038 per dollar on Tuesday, the weakest since September. The 7.2 level has been considered a "harder line in the sand" for the central bank for years. articles.author: Bitcoin World
articles.summary: The Crypto Fear & Greed Index registered a score of 24 as of April 8th. This is a marginal increase of one point from the previous day, but it's still a good sign for investor sentiment in the cryptocurrency market. The index is a product of Alternative.me.

articles.title: Bitcoin poised for surge as China pledges response to Trump's 50% tariff move
articles.author: BTC Manager
articles.summary: With China threatening strong retaliation against Trump's tariff demands, Bitcoin might be primed for a rise in value. Bitcoin's value might be boosted by China's threat of retaliation against the Trump's tariffs. Bitcoin is a medium of exchange traded on the Bitcoin Exchange.

articles.title: Justice Department Restructures Cryptocurrency Enforcement Amid Legal Challenges
articles.author: The Arabian Post
articles.summary: The U.S. Department of Justice is changing its approach to cryptocurrency-related crimes. The National Cryptocurrency Enforcement Team was established in 2022 to tackle the illicit use of digital assets. It is being integrated into the Computer Crime and Cybercrime sections of the Justice Department.

articles.title: Will Dogecoin Price Ever Reach $1? Top Analysts Weigh In
articles.author: Coin Gape
articles.summary: Dogecoin price recorded a notable rally during the last quarter of 2024. The rally drove optimism within the DOGE community that the largest meme coin may reach $1 in 2025. However several challenges including tariff wars, minimal utility, and Elon Musk's claim that the price will always relate to the production cost remain.

articles.title: Revolutionary Google AI Mode Unveils Powerful Image Questioning
articles.author: Bitcoin World
articles.summary: Google's latest AI Mode update allows users to ask complex questions about crypto-related topics using visual searches. It's a step closer to Google's vision of a world where visual searches are as powerful as text-based searches and is useful for crypto enthusiasts.

articles.summary: Ripple is set to acquire global prime brokerage platform Hidden Road for $1.25 billion. This makes Ripple the first crypto-native firm to own and operate a multi-asset prime broker with an established institutional network. Ripple noted that the deal will deepen.

articles.author: Bitcoin Magazine

articles.summary: The U.S. Department of Justice is redirecting resources towards immigration enforcement, terrorism and drug trafficking. Deputy Attorney General Todd Blanche quoted President Donald Trump's memo as saying it's time to "end the regulatory weaponization" of the cryptocurrency industry.

articles.summary: Canary Capital has filed for a SUI exchange-traded fund with the Chicago Board Options Exchange (CBOE). The news was first reported by Solid Intel on X. Canary Capital is a well-known and successful crypto investment firm. The news has excited the crypto community.

articles.title: U.S. Justice Department Ends Crypto Crime Unit Amid Regulatory Overhaul
articles.author: Crypto Economy
articles.summary: The Justice Department disbands its crypto crime unit. New directives prioritize prosecuting individual bad actors over targeting exchanges or wallets. The department is not a digital assets regulator anymore. It's more about promoting innovation and reducing enforcement-driven oversight, as Trump's pro-crypto policies do.

articles.title: DOJ Disbands Crypto Unit, Alleges Biden Administration Used Branch for ‘Reckless' Regulation
articles.author: The Daily Hodl
articles.summary: The National Cryptocurrency Enforcement Unit (NCET) is being scrapped by the Department of Justice. NCET was established during the Biden administration and focused on crypto-related investigations. It was disbanded in a new memo released on Monday. It will be replaced by another unit.

articles.title: U.S. Justice Dept disbands cryptocurrency enforcement unit
articles.author: Kevin Lamarque
articles.summary: The U.S. Justice Department is disbanding its National Cryptocurrency Enforcement Team. Prosecutors will focus on criminal investigations involving cartels and terrorist groups that use digital currency to finance illicit business, according to a memo seen by Reuters. The memo was obtained by Chris Prentice and Sarah N. Lynch.
